alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:47PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and Franklin Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 547 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Monteagle to 8 miles north of Skyline. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Bridgeport, Decherd, Estill Springs, Stevenson, Cowan, Huntland, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee and Anderson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee.
